text: if you're looking for a really cheap
easy supplement to take in right after
your workout to start the repair process
chocolate milk
really easy there's great research on it
it's got carbohydrates it's got protein
it's easily digestible it works great if
you want to get a little more exotic you
can start you know with whey protein
plus different carbohydrate blends whey
protein even mixed with Gatorade things
like that all those things work do you
need to eat right after you're done not
necessarily it's really more the total
protein intake throughout a day that
carries the most weight but there's no
reason not to either if your diet
through the rest of the day is bad okay
and you don't eat frequently enough or
enough period anything you eat right in
and around your workouts isn't going to
fix all that so what happens is you have
this period of time post-workout where
you're going to pull more carbohydrate
into the muscle to replenish all that
glycogen you just use now if you're
working out at a moderate intensity from
day to day does that matter not highly
if you're going to do multiple
high-intensity bouts over the course of
a week like we would get with an athlete
in training like you would get with
somebody who's training for a race now
the carbohydrate replenishment does
matter so trying to take carbs in after
your workout you're now tapping into
this repair window the biggest thing is
don't use the workout as an excuse to
gorge on whatever you want when you're
done especially if your target is fat
loss realize that if you just did a 200
to 250 calorie workout on the treadmill
and you walk your way down to the juice
bar and you go grab a 600 calorie shake
it's probably not an even trade
